New Records: Kieffer Moore scored Wales' fastest goal since 2003, timed at 37 seconds, ending their longest scoreless streak since September 2012
Key Match Events: Wales scored an early double with goals by Kieffer Moore and Harry Wilson within three minutes
Montenegro pressured Wales with aggressive attacks and challenging conditions
Leeds goalkeeper Karl Darlow made crucial saves and became Wales' oldest debutant since World War II
Pre-Game Insights: Wales faced Montenegro's strong attacking lineup and challenging pitch conditions
New boss Craig Bellamy aimed to build on an impressive start against Turkey
Post-Match Reflections: Wales secured their first win under Craig Bellamy and showed resilience despite late pressure from Montenegro
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in heavy rain, raising questions about the pitch suitability
Montenegro's national stadium in Podgorica was deemed unplayable by UEFA, leading to the match in Niksic
